ygData.subject: Re: Patch Message
ygData.msgSnippet: ... wizard or druid count. Possibly, but you re assuming that the only reason someone will go anon/roleplay is to avoid people asking them for the services
ygData.messageBody:
> I would say a bard count is infinitely more accurate than say a
wizard or druid count.

Possibly, but you're assuming that the only reason someone will go
anon/roleplay is to avoid people asking them for the services that
their class can provide. It's not the only reason present and it's
hard to say if it's the most common reason or not. Many Hate/Fear
raids, for example, ask that everyone goes Anon/RP so they don't get
raid crashers. i.e. People would do a /w all 50 55 and if a lot of
people showed up in Hate, then they'd know it was safe to port up.

And, btw, that 74 count on Xegony more than likely missed me, since I
usually play during primetime and have been on Roleplay since they
introduced the ability. It's all those damn stalkers. :)

Darkfox
Xegony
